abstract: After more than 20 years, General Electric is getting back into the TV business.
snippet: After more than 20 years, General Electric is getting back into the TV business.
lead_paragraph: In 1987, General Electric sold its television business to Thomson, allowing the French company to continue to use the GE brand on TVs. That license expired in 2004, and now G.E. is getting back into the TV business — at least halfway.

headline.main: GE to Make TVs Again, This Time With NBC Web Video
